attributes.action: Reform Family Court to recognise & protect victims of coercive control
attributes.additional_details:
Perpetrators are allowed to continuously apply to family court to abuse their victims over pertained 'breaches' of a CAO
Judges/Court fail to recognise emotional abuse/coercive control of Perpetrators
Judges/Court fail to protect victims of coercive control 
Family court appears not to allow respondents to defend against perpetrator 'claims'
New partners of abuse victims dragged into system by perpetrator & judges with no right of reply
Perpetrator skillfully manipulates the Judge/Court System
attributes.background:
Educate Family Judges to recognise a Perpetrator of Emotional abuse/coercive control
Prevent Perpetrator from being able to use court system as a means of repeated abuse
Allow Respondents proper rights to defend against perpetrator using submitted evidence
Protect children from Perpetrator

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about training and education of judges, and legal proceedings regarding family cases, are a matter for the judiciary, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to review how the justice system handles cases involving victims of coercive control, if that's something you would like to happen.
